get.description: List all items in the repository

parameters.name: unfold
parameters.description: Unfolds the specified fields (they must be of type "link") - Comma-separated list

allow_id.description: Normally you cannot specify the id during creation, setting this to true will override that behaviour

check_vat.description: Only for "master-data": checks for the correctness of VAT number

send_signup_mail.description: Only for "master-data": sends the signup mail

id.description: The id of the created item

get.description: Get one item from the repository

parameters.name: unfold
parameters.description: Unfolds the specified fields (they must be of type "link") - Comma-separated list

data.description: Properties that you want to edit

schema.description: Please note that from/to and segments properties are mutually exclusive, as well as ids, codes and geos

cart.description: Identifier of the cart you want to add this search to; refer to "Cart and paxes management" in the docs

search.description: You can perform several searches in a single request (e.g., a flight and a hotel)

segments.description: You can search for several segments in a row (e.g. a flight that goes FCO->LHR and back, or more)

occupancy.description: Each item represent a room you are requesting. In caso of services that do not provide room support (flights, outdoor activities, etc), specify only one item in the list. For each room, you can choose whether to create new pax, or use existing ones. Please refer to "Cart and paxes management" section in the docs

children.description: Each item represents a child's age

oneOf.description: Each item represents a pax id

merge_hotels.description: If results for the same hotel are returned from more than one provider, you can choose if you want two different items or a merged one (with a subsequent disambiguation step)

items.description: Id of a specific tag you want to add to the reservation

client_country.description: Optional user nationality, used by some of the suppliers

expand_next_step.description: If true, each item in the response is gonna have a "next_step" property (if supported) with the list of its sub-items (e.g. rooms for a hotel)

cart.description: Id of the cart you are working in

search_id.description: Id of this search; use this id throughout the whole booking process up to the "add to cart" request

step.description: Identifier of this step - Use this in the next request in order to refer to this list

final.description: If this flag is true, you are in the final step and can proceed to "add to cart"

pick_type.description: If and how many groups needs to be satisfied with the subsequent request

allow_partial.description: Some suppliers allow to temporarily pick a single group even if they are all required, for the only purpose of glimpsing into the next step and retrieve its items

partial.description: Whenever a partial step is performed (see "allow_partial" property), this flag will be true in the response, indicating the this is a response for informative purposes only and should not be used to build the next request

groups.description: The items are returned in groups, and for each group you will have to perform a specific action (indicated by the group "type")

idx.description: Index of the group, you must use this to refer to the group in the subsequent request

service.description: Only for informative purposes, if there are more than one service, this will be the index of the service this group belongs to

accommodation.description: Index of the accommodation this group belongs to (from the original "occupancy" parameter in the search request)

items.description: List of the actual items belonging to this group

warnings.description: If some warnings are issued, they will be reported here in a textual format

multilang_string.description: Helper item for strings that need to be passed in multiple languages

descriptions_list.description: List of paragraphs in multiple languages

oneOf.description: When reading, this is the URL of the file
When writing, you have to pass base64 encoded data and mime type

categories.description: Currently only one category is supported, in the future we plan to allow for more than one

full_name.description: (Nome completo) Will be auto-filled by Travio with: commercial_name if present, otherwise: company_name+legal_form if company, name+surname if private

segment.description: A specific segment from point A to point B of a transport service (e.g., flights, ships, etc)

segment_point.description: A departure or arrival point, to be used in "segment" objects (see above)

points.description: Specific geographical point; you can refer to the point via a standard code, whose type may vary accordingly to the service type it is needed for. For example, you will use IATA for flights, or UIC for trains, etc

not_found.description: The specified resource was not found
